topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: Nanna Knows Best (Fish)
ideas.premise: A young Melburnian attempts fancy seafood dish, while Nana gives deadpan commentary about catching it 'properly' back in her day.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of modern food trends vs. old-school Aussie fishing wisdom is hilarious.

ideas.title: The Mythical Snapper of St Kilda Pier
ideas.premise: Kids gather to hear Nana's exaggerated St Kilda Pier fishing tales, which feature a snapper the size of Luna Park's Scenic Railway.
ideas.why_funny: Everyone knows St Kilda Pier; Nana's story is ridiculously over-the-top.

ideas.title: Beaumaris Bay Bingo
ideas.premise: Nana’s knitting group at the Beaumaris yacht club plays bingo, but the calls are all local sea creatures and fishing terms.
ideas.why_funny: Gentle humour derived from combining mundane bingo with nautical lingo.

ideas.title: Saltwater Secrets of Port Phillip Bay
ideas.premise: A marine biologist interviews Nana about local sea life, but she only gives vague, folklore-based answers.
ideas.why_funny: Scientist's frustration versus Nana's stubborn adherence to tall tales.

ideas.title: Fairy Penguins and Federation Square
ideas.premise: Nana tells tourists fairy penguin stories so wild they believe there’s a penguin colony IN Federation Square.
ideas.why_funny: Misinformation spread with conviction is amusing; tourists believing anything.

ranking: The Mythical Snapper of St Kilda Pier
